rationale.emotions.chesspawn

Interface IPawn

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Knight

    public interface IPawn
    This interface represents the abilities that any given pawn should have. All pawns that intend to be placed on a ChessBoard would need to implement this interface. If not, then they cannot be used in conjunction with PawnMoveManager.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void moveTo(Location toLocation, ChessBoard board)
      A utility method that causes the current pawn to move to a given location on the chess board.
      List<Location> nextMoveLocations(Location fromLocation, ChessBoard board)
      This method retrieves the list of valid locations on a given ChessBoard keeping in mind any specific Chess game rules the current pawn may be bound by.

    • Method Detail

      • nextMoveLocations

        List<Location> nextMoveLocations(Location fromLocation,
                               ChessBoard board)
        This method retrieves the list of valid locations on a given ChessBoard keeping in mind any specific Chess game rules the current pawn may be bound by.
        Parameters:
        fromLocation - - A Location object that indicates from where to start.
        board - - A ChessBoard object on which to operate.
        Returns:
        - A List of Location that represent the next plausible locations to where the current pawn can move to.

      • moveTo

        void moveTo(Location toLocation,
          ChessBoard board)
        A utility method that causes the current pawn to move to a given location on the chess board.
        Parameters:
        toLocation - - A Location that represents the location to where to move to.
        board - - A ChessBoard object on which to operate.
